votebox.middle.view

Class RenderPage

  • java.lang.Object
    • votebox.middle.view.RenderPage

  • public class RenderPage
extends java.lang.Object
    A RenderPage consists of a list of drawables. Each drawble contains all the information which the ViewManager needs to draw this drawable to the view, including their location.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • setNavigation

        public void setNavigation(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.LinkedList<IDrawable>> uidmap)
                   throws LayoutParserException
        Call this method to set the navigational links for all the elements that belong to this page. Elements, when parsed from the layout file, will simply have properties set to denote the UID of the element who is "up, down, left, right, next, and previous." This method effectively converts those UID properties into actual pointers. After this method is called, the elements will be able to function properly as focusable elements on the screen.
        Parameters:
        uidmap - This method will use this mapping of uid->element to "connect the dots." When an element references another element, it will use this map to determine what the actual object reference is for that element.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - This method throws if any element references a UID that is not in uidmap.
        LayoutParserException

      • setBackgroundImage

        public void setBackgroundImage(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.LinkedList<IDrawable>> uidmap)
                        throws LayoutParserException
        Invoking this method will mandate that if there is a property declared on this page named by Properties.BACKGROUND_LABEL, the value of that property will be the first element in this page's layout. This is useful for declaring a background image, because the first item in the list will be the first item that is drawn to the display, meaning that all items drawn after the first will be layered on top of the first item.
        Parameters:
        uidmap - This is a mapping from uid->drawable. This is convenient to have in this method.
        Throws:
        IncorrectTypeException - This method throws if the property was declared incorrectly.
        LayoutParserException

      • getFromDictionary

        private IFocusable getFromDictionary(java.lang.String uid,
                           java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.LinkedList<IDrawable>> uidmap)
                              throws RenderPage.ElementNotFoundException
        This is a private helper method for setNavigation. It's purpose is to do a lookup in the uidmap provided and return the RenderCardElement that is mapped to a given uid.
        Parameters:
        uid - The method will look up this uid.
        uidmap - The method will look up uid in this mapping of uid->element.
        Returns:
        This method will return the RenderCardElement which is mapped to uid.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - This method will throw if there is no mapping in uidmap for uid.
        RenderPage.ElementNotFoundException

      • draw

        public void draw(IView view)
        Call this method to draw this RenderPage to a view.
        Parameters:
        view - Draw the card to this view.

      • getChildren

        public java.util.List<IDrawable> getChildren()
        Call this method to get the elements that make up this page.
        Returns:
        _children This method returns a list of all the elements that belong to this page.

      • initFromViewManager

        public void initFromViewManager(IViewManager vmadapter,
                       IBallotLookupAdapter lookupadapter,
                       IAdapter ballotadapter,
                       IViewFactory factory,
                       IBallotVars ballotvars)
        The ViewManager will call this method when it wishes to initialize the state of this drawable. This should include things like strategy/state setting/syncing with the ballot. Here, we simply call initFromViewManager on each of the child elements.
        Parameters:
        vmadapter - The child elements will use this adapter as a reference to the view manager.
        lookupadapter - The child elements will use this adapter to make queries on the state of the ballot.
        ballotadapter - The child elements will use this adapter to make changes to the state of the ballot.
        factory - Use this factory to make new images.
        ballotvars - Use this to find the path to the image files.

      • getUniqueIDs

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getUniqueIDs()
        Returns:
        a list of all the unique ids of elements on this page
